result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Scott Werling

defendant.name: Werling, Nicholas Scott
defendant.address: 252 S Musket Ridge Drive Apt 1, Sun Prairie, WI 53590

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:30 AM Defendant Nicholas Scott Werling appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Mark D. Richards appeared by video for Nicholas Scott Werling. Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Kara Davis from Justice Point sworn in and testified by video. State requests continuance for second witness to be present; Defense objects with argument. Court grants continuance.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point: Rock County Supervision  Report
from defendant re: speedy trail request
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:25 PM Defendant Nicholas Scott Werling in court.  Attorney Natalie Wisco for Attorney Mark D. Richards appeared by video for Nicholas Scott Werling.  Attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Court orders Cash bond in the amount of $500,000.00 with original conditions from previous bond. Preliminary hearing through Zoom requested. Preliminary Hearing set for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 AM by Zoom.

Possess no weapons. Absolute Sobriety  Curfew: Defendant must stay in his residence from 6pm to 6am, except for employment.  No contact directly or indirectly with victim ATR, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. GPS monitoring if released.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Not to be within 500 feet of any schools. REFUSED TO SIGN.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
